result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Sheri Mona Finch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber, out of county travel, & transfer to another county are granted at the discretion of  jail administration.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $409.18, plus surcharges.

Defendant to submit to a DNA swab and pay the surcharge. 

To make reasonable efforts to obtain/maintain full time employment. 

Absolute sobriety.  No bars/taverns.  Not to use/possess alcohol. 

To complete treatment at discretion of Supervising Agent.

If probation is discharged/revoked with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due and/or other collection procedures will be implemented. If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
